request.description:
Add an assignment to a class.

## Path Params
* class id

## Body Params
* name
* due (date)
* weight_id

This will not create a mod.

This will add the assignment to all enrolled students, as well as students enroll after this is added.

request.description:
Shows all classes. Can be used as a search with multiple filters.

## Behavior:
   Only searches the current period

## Filters:
  * school
    * school id
  * professor.name
    * professor name
  * class.status
    * status id
    * For ghost classes, use 0.
  * class.name
    * class name
  * class.number
    * class number
  * class.meet_days
    * class meet_days
  * class.length
    * 1st Half
    * 2nd Half
    * Full Term
    * Custom

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-expose-headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: server

header.description: Custom header

request.description:
## Weights

  Weights are added as an array of weights one time through this route. They require name and weight. If is_points is false, they need to sum to 100. After a class has weights, the appropriate edit route needs to be used.
  
  This should only be used if the class is in the Weights status, and it will progress the class to the Assignments status.

## Required fields

name, 
number, 
meet_days, 
meet_start_time, 
meet_end_time,
seat_count, 
class_start, 
class_end, 
is_enrollable, 
grade_scale,
is_editable, 
class_period_id, 
is_syllabus, 
is_points

## Optional fields

crn, 
credits, 
location, 
professor_id, 
class_type

request.description:

grade_scale: A,90|B,80|C,70|D,60

name, 
number, 
meet_days, 
meet_start_time, 
meet_end_time,
seat_count, 
class_start, 
class_end, 
is_enrollable, 
is_editable, 
class_period_id, 
is_syllabus

crn, 
credits, 
location, 
professor_id, 
class_type,
grade_scale, 
is_points

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-expose-headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.description: A name for the server

header.name: x-request-id
header.description: Custom header

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-expose-headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: content-length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content
